name: 1950s STILNOVO Vintage DESK LAMP EAMES
description:
Rare 1950s vintage tall desk lamp Stilnovo design (max height 45 CM). 

Excellent and beautiful vintage item of Stilnovo ArteLuce lighting era.

Description:

The lampshade is made made of aluminium lacquered in matt-black.

The arm is made of steel rod fixed to the lampshade with a ball joint to allow for adjustments. 

The foot base is made of metal covered with lacquered matt white paint.

The original switch is located on the base. The lamp takes one Edison screw (screwfit) bulb. It is fitted with a EU plug. As with all vintage electrical equipment, it is advisable to have it checked by a qualified electrician before use.


Condition:

In excellent vintage condition and in good working order. The lampshade, steel arm and base are all in great vintage condition. The black finish on the lampshade is in good condition however minimal age related wear to the paint. Overall some wear to the lamp however this is conducive to the vintage age of the lamp.

Dimensions:

Diameter of lampshade: 27cm

Max Height: 45 cm

Width and Length of base: 10 cm x 15 cm

Height of lampshade: 15 cm

Length of cord: 100 cm

Approximate weight packed: 2.5kg

Markings: Impressed on Base “Dansk Designs Denmark IHQ”

name: Alessi Juicy Salif Citrus Squeezer Philippe Starck (1990)
description:
As well as being the most controversial citrus fruit squeezer of the 20th century, Juicy Salif by Alessi has also become one of the icons of design of the 1990's, and it continues to be one of the most provocatively intelligent articles of the Alessi collection. Design Philippe Starck, 1990. Made in Italy

This juicer by Alessi is a good example of when things work, both functionally and aesthetically.

The story is that the designer was eating squid one day in 1990, and squeezing lemons ,when he started rethinking how citrus reamers work and look.  The basic model of the reamer was essentially  unchanged in the preceding 65 years (as we’ve seen before). Phillipe Starck started drawing on his napkin, beginning with a squid and modifying the look until he ended up with this streamline design.

A cult classic for sure!

Designer: Philippe Starck - 

Year of Design: 1990 -

Material: Cast aluminium with polyamide feet -

Dimensions: H: 29cm/11.5 Inches; Dia: 14cm/5.5 inches

name: Danish Chairs Noritsugu Oda Orig Price £100
description:
Original and now out of print 1999 1st edition.

In good condition - secondhand copy.

Danish Chairs is the only book to survey the innovative, prolific output of Denmark's design elite durin g the years when they turned again and again to the chair.

Each style is shown, accompanied by technical details and not es about the designer.

Danish furniture design burst onto the international scene in the late '20s and soon came to be revered as classic. Danish Chairs is the only book available to survey the innovative, prolific output of Denmark's design elite during the years when they turned again and again to the chair. Architects and designers are notorious chair aficionados; some would say they are obsessed with chairs. With over 150 examples of fine Danish chair design by 66 premier designers, Danish Chairs is the perfect book for devotees. Each style is shown from multiple angles, accompanied by technical details and notes about the designer, as well as schematic line drawings for more than 25 chairs. With landmark works by Kaare Klint (the Peacock chair), Arne Jacobsen (the Ant chair), Finn Juhl, and Hans J. Wegner, Danish Chairs is a unique reference and source of creative inspiration for all who admire the chair.

Paperback: 224 pages
Publisher: Chronicle Books; First edition (February 1, 1999)
Language: English
ISBN-10: 0811822575
ISBN-13: 978-0811822572
Product Dimensions: 11.8 x 8.6 x 0.6 inches

name: DANSK DESIGN SPIDER CAST IRON CANDLEHOLDER
description:
RETRO DANISH DANSK DESIGN SPIDER CAST IRON CANDLEHOLDER
Desgined by Jens Quistgaard for Dansk Design

Classic vintage Danish mid century modern piece cast iron candleholder designed circa 1955 for Dansk Designs.

The base is finished with small black enamel pads in order not to scratch furniture.

Stamped: Dansk Designs Denmark JHQ.
Height: 3,5 cm (1.4")
Width: 10,5 cm (4.1")

Holds 12 thin candles.

Desgined by Jens Quistgaard  for Danish Dansk Design.

Jens Quistgaard's cast iron candle holders were much like his now famous pepper grinders; sculptural, organic and very unique.

This particular specimen, commonly referred to as the "Spider", but in fact named "Tiny Taper Holder" by Dansk, was his first and most popular. 

This example is in excellent vintage condition. A unique addition to your modern collection.

name: Scandinavian Furniture: A Sourcebook of Classic Designs for the 21st Century
description:
Product Description

Scandinavia has been the source of some of the most important furniture designs of the 20th century. Today, a new generation of designers continues that tradition, creating pieces that are functional, comfortable and appealing to look at. This book updates the history of design in the Nordic nations, and illustrates more than 500 of the best current furniture from over seventy producers, most of them in full colour. It also includes detailed product specifications and sources, biographies of important Nordic designers, and a comprehensive bibliography. It will appeal to everyone with an interest in modern furniture, as well as designers, architects, collectors and students with a special interest in Scandinavian design. 

About the Author

Judith Gura is a professor at the New York School of Interior Design, where she directs the design history program, and an associate professor at the Pratt Institute. A specialist in Scandinavian design, she writes frequently on the subject for a number of publications. 

Product details

Hardcover: 304 pages 
Publisher: Thames & Hudson (5 Nov 2007) 
Language English 
ISBN-10: 0500513805 
ISBN-13: 978-0500513804 
Product Dimensions: 28.2 x 22.4 x 2.8 cm

name: Charles & Ray Eames USPS PANE of 16 Postage Stamps
description:
Product description:

We'll readily admit that USPS stamps aren't the sexiest items we could write about. Then again, when they feature the classic designs of Charles & Ray Eames, there are few stamps that can compare. 

The USPS Charles & Ray Eames Postage Stamp Collection is a set of 16 stamps featuring some of the Eames' most popular designs. Honored in the collection are the Eames Lounge Chair, Eames Molded Plywood Chair LCW, and the Eames Hang-It-All!

In the 1950’s Charles & Ray Eames began a mission to create furniture for the masses, furniture that would be considered functional, elegant and affordable to common people. Their furniture has since proven longevity, but has become synonymous with high design at premium prices. With a new edition of commemorative stamps that honor their legacy, Eames has a real shot now at becoming the household name it has long deserved to be.

#4333a 42¢ Christmas Card  
#4333b Crosspatch Fabric Design  
#4333c 42¢ Stacking Chairs 
#4333d 42¢ Case Study House
#4333e 42¢ Wired-Base Table 
#4333f 42¢ Lounge Chair & Ottoman 
#4333g Hang-It-All 
#4333h 42¢ La Chaise
#4333i 42¢ Tops 
#4333j 42¢ Wire Mesh Chair 
#4333k 42¢ Magazine Cover 
#4333l 42¢ House of Cards
#4333m 42¢ Molded Plywood Sculpture 
#4333n 42¢ Eames Storage Unit
#4333o Aluminum Group Chair 
#4333p 42¢ Molded Plywood Chair

A great addition to your vintage collection the USPS Charles & Ray Eames Postage Stamp Collection  can be framed and become a focal point in an modern retro room layout!

name: Danish Modern by  Andrew Hollingsworth
description:
Product Description:

Twentieth century Danish furniture design is simple and clean, mixes well with other design styles, and has an inherent value and history beyond its beauty. In "Danish Modern", Andrew Hollingsworth explores the history of Danish design, from the earliest cabinetmakers' guilds in the 1770s through the impact of two world wars, and its evolution into the twentieth century. Through beautiful photos, the book emphasizes how well Danish Modern furniture works in contemporary and traditional homes. It includes a market guide with tips, facts and resources that discusses veneer vs. solid wood, places to find Danish Modern furniture, and how to care for it; and an extensive resource section.

Product details
Hardcover: 176 pages
Publisher: Gibbs M. Smith Inc (1 Nov 2008)
Language English
ISBN-10: 1586858114
ISBN-13: 978-1586858117
Product Dimensions: 25.7 x 22.6 x 2.8 cm

name: 1960s Retro Danish Safari Chair N. Eilersen
description:
Vintage 1960s Danish black/brown lacquered teak Safari Armchair  designed by Jens Juul  Eilersen and Eric Wørts for Danish manufacturers N. Eilersen A / S.
 
This extremely rare, beautiful, practical and at the same time comfortable design of the Danish series of Safari armchairs designed by the likes of Kaare Klint and Rud Rasmussen. 
 
An excellent example of Danish craftsmanship style of the 1950-60s furniture designed by Hans J. Wegner, Finn Juhl and Arne Vodder. 

Classic and rare vintage design of the safari armchair by Jens Juls Eilersen. and Eric Wørts. This comes with a colour copy of the original instructions leaflet.

N. Eilersen A / S was founded in 1895 and gave the name and life to many classics. The founder Niels Eilersen was the first in Denmark, which used steam to shape wood, and innovation and tradition still represents the company. Since 1930-s have N. Eilersen A / S produced furniture with a focus on high quality materials, comfort and durability. The strategy has Eilersen to a known and recognized brand both nationally and internationally, and several sofa models involve predicate "state of the art". N. Eilersen A / S is a family business, currently run by 4th generation.
 
Dimensions: H760mm X W610mm X L 610mm. Seat to floor 390mm
Weight: 10 kg
Material: Frame in teak.
Condition: In Excellent condition.

The structure of the teak frame is solid with no breakages. 
Teak frame is lacquered in a black/brown finish.  
The armchair and canvas are in excellent vintage condition with minimal marks around the legs in line with the vintage state and look of the item.  The canvas upholstery material is the original canvas and is in great condition with no tears or signs of weakness; however this is in a vintage state. 
Overall the armchair shows signs of aging adding to the overall vintage look of the armchair.
